column4: i am going to install debian on a new partition. will i be able to access the files on the old partition (ubuntu)?
going to create a new partition. do i need to defrag or something similar?
under windows, it would probably be a good idea
so in ubuntu, all i need to do is insert the live cd to create a partition?
yes, but it might be wise to defrag under windows, then install, is what i'm saying
then don't worry about it, partition and install
do i need to install grub on the new partition?
grub will install automatically at the end of the install
so will i have 2 grubs? one for ubuntu and one for debian?
no, it will overwrite the old one
so it will recognize that i have ubuntu. got it.
not much longer... why do you mention that
sorry. i thought u r also in #debian...
i go to #debian on occasion(because i use it), but i find the people there.. well, less than desirable to be around...
so true!! i want to try debian and was amazed by the attitude there!
